services.name: Delay
services.description_short: Pause workflow execution for a specified duration.
services.description_long: Add timed pauses between workflow steps. Wait for seconds, minutes, or hours before continuing to the next step. Essential for rate limiting, API cooldowns, and timed sequences.

tools.name: Wait
tools.description: Pause execution for a fixed duration (seconds, minutes, or hours)

tools.name: Wait Until
tools.description: Pause execution until a specific date/time is reached

tools.name: Random Delay
tools.description: Pause for a random duration within a range (for natural timing)

services.name: Schedule
services.description_short: Trigger workflows on a schedule or at specific times.
services.description_long: Run workflows on cron schedules, at specific times, or on recurring intervals. Combine with conditions for business-hours-only execution, weekend skipping, and timezone-aware scheduling.

tools.name: Cron Schedule
tools.description: Trigger on a cron expression (e.g., every Monday at 9am)

tools.name: Recurring Interval
tools.description: Trigger every N minutes, hours, or days

tools.name: Run Once At
tools.description: Schedule a one-time execution at a specific date/time

tools.name: Business Hours Only
tools.description: Only execute during specified business hours and days

services.name: If / Else
services.description_short: Branch workflow based on conditions and logic.
services.description_long: Add conditional branching to your workflows. Evaluate expressions, compare values, check data existence, and route execution down different paths. The foundation of intelligent automation.

tools.name: If / Else
tools.description: Branch based on a true/false condition expression

tools.name: Switch / Case
tools.description: Route to different branches based on a value matching multiple cases

tools.name: Data Exists
tools.description: Check if a value exists, is not null/empty, and branch accordingly

tools.name: Compare Values
tools.description: Compare two values (equals, greater than, less than, contains, matches regex)

tools.name: Gate / Approval
tools.description: Pause workflow and wait for manual approval or external signal before continuing

services.name: Loop
services.description_short: Iterate over lists, repeat actions, and batch process data.
services.description_long: Process arrays and lists by running steps for each item. Supports for-each iteration, while loops with exit conditions, batch processing with configurable chunk sizes, and parallel iteration for maximum throughput.

tools.name: For Each
tools.description: Execute steps once for each item in an array or list

tools.name: While Loop
tools.description: Repeat steps while a condition remains true (with max iteration safety)

tools.name: Batch Process
tools.description: Process items in configurable batch sizes with optional delay between batches

tools.name: Parallel For Each
tools.description: Process all items simultaneously using Radial Burst parallel execution

services.name: Transform
services.description_short: Map, filter, reshape, and transform data between steps.
services.description_long: Transform data as it flows through your workflow. Map fields between services, filter arrays, merge objects, extract values with JSONPath, and format data for downstream steps. The glue that connects incompatible APIs.

tools.name: Map Fields
tools.description: Rename, rearrange, and reshape object fields from one format to another

tools.name: Filter Array
tools.description: Keep only items that match a condition from an array

tools.name: Merge Objects
tools.description: Combine multiple objects or arrays into one

tools.name: Extract Value
tools.description: Pull a specific value from nested data using a path expression

tools.name: Format Text
tools.description: Build formatted strings using templates and variable interpolation

tools.name: Compute
tools.description: Perform math operations, string manipulation, or date calculations

services.name: Trigger
services.description_short: Start workflows from webhooks, events, or manual triggers.
services.description_long: Define how your workflow starts. Listen for incoming webhooks, respond to service events, accept manual triggers, or start from form submissions. Every workflow needs a trigger ‚Äî this is where it begins.

tools.name: Webhook Trigger
tools.description: Start workflow when an HTTP webhook is received

tools.name: Manual Trigger
tools.description: Start workflow manually with optional input parameters

tools.name: Event Listener
tools.description: Start workflow when a specific event fires from another service

tools.name: Form Submission
tools.description: Start workflow when a form is submitted with captured data

services.name: Error Handling
services.description_short: Catch errors, retry failures, and handle edge cases.
services.description_long: Make your workflows resilient. Catch and handle errors from any step, set up automatic retries with exponential backoff, define fallback paths, and send alerts when things go wrong.

tools.name: Try / Catch
tools.description: Wrap steps in error handling ‚Äî catch failures and run fallback steps

tools.name: Retry with Backoff
tools.description: Automatically retry a failed step with configurable delay and max attempts

tools.name: Error Alert
tools.description: Send a notification (email, Slack, webhook) when an error occurs

tools.name: Stop Workflow
tools.description: Immediately halt the entire workflow with a status message
